Key Arguments: The proposed powers would allow the ACMA to silence viewpoints not favored by the agency.
Granting such powers would curb free speech in a democratic society.
The ACMA, as a government agency, should not decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
It is the responsibility of individuals to discern and decide for themselves what is misinformation or disinformation.
Notable Quotes: Such power is undue in a democratic society because the ACMA, being a government agency, has no right to decide whether something is 'misinformation' or 'disinformation' on behalf of the people.
